info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 30 at 8:33PM MDT until July 30 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MDT FOR NORTHWESTERN JUDITH BASIN...SOUTH CENTRAL CHOUTEAU AND EAST CENTRAL CASCADE COUNTIES... At 831 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 11 miles south of Highwood, or 26 miles south of Fort Benton, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Judith Basin, south central Chouteau and east central Cascade Counties. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Heavy rainfall with this storm may lead to minor flash flooding, especially in low lying areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
